perturbation.original_text: 1.1 ADVERTISING shall mean any paid advertisements, links, pointers, sponsorships, buttons, banners, navigation, or any other placements or promotions or similar services or rights on a Site, but excluding Advertising that is not paid for or which is part of an overall partnering or revenue sharing arrangement and any Product Listings.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 Paid Promotions shall mean any paid advertisements, links, pointers, sponsorships, buttons, banners, navigation, or any other placements or promotions or similar services or rights on a Site, but excluding Promotions that are not paid for or which is part of an overall partnering or revenue sharing arrangement and any Product Listings.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'ADVERTISING' is replaced with 'Paid Promotions' in the definition itself, creating confusion as to whether all forms of promotions are included or only those that are explicitly paid, which could lead to disputes about unpaid promotional activities.

perturbation.original_text: 1.3 CAREER CENTER GROSS MARGIN shall have the meaning ascribed thereto in Section 10.5.1  [CO-BRANDED CAREER CENTER].
perturbation.changed_text: 1.3 Career Resource Revenue shall have the meaning ascribed thereto in Section 10.5.1  [CO-BRANDED CAREER CENTER].
perturbation.explanation: The term 'CAREER CENTER GROSS MARGIN' is replaced with 'Career Resource Revenue'. It is unclear if this refers to the same metric used for calculating revenue related to the career center, creating uncertainty about the basis for revenue calculation.

perturbation.original_text: 1.8 DEDUCTIBLES shall mean credits for claims, allowances, seller rebates or returned goods, commissions paid to any third parties, and sales, service, excise, use, value-added and other similar taxes (excluding income taxes) actually paid.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.8 Allowable Offsets shall mean credits for claims, allowances, vendor discounts or returned goods, commissions paid to any third parties, and sales, service, excise, use, value-added and other similar taxes (excluding income taxes) actually paid.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'DEDUCTIBLES' is replaced with 'Allowable Offsets'. Also 'seller rebates' replaced with 'vendor discounts.' This introduces ambiguity whether the two terms, Deductibles, and Allowable Offsets, have the same conditions, leading to potential dispute about what charges are applicable.
